intro: Palicourea acicularis, commonly known as the needleleaf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are often arranged in whorls around the stem. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Palicourea acicularis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
